Convex Analysis (Rockafellar, 1970) -- Chapter 03 -- Section 11 -- Part 2

open scoped Pointwisesection Chap03section Section11

Hard-case separation: in the quotient by a submodule, a convex relatively open set Unknown identifier `C`C can be strictly separated from a point in the affine span of its image but outside the image.

lemma exists_strictSep_point_of_mem_affineSpan_openIn_convex (n : Nat) (C : Set (Fin n )) (D : Submodule (Fin n )) (hCne : C.Nonempty) (hCconv : Convex C) (hCrelopen : U : Set (Fin n ), IsOpen U C = U (affineSpan C : Set (Fin n ))) {m0 : Fin n } (hq0S : D.mkQ m0 (D.mkQ '' C)) (hq0A : D.mkQ m0 affineSpan (D.mkQ '' C)) : f : StrongDual ((Fin n ) D), c C, f (D.mkQ c) < f (D.mkQ m0) := by classical let Q := (Fin n ) D let : (Fin n ) [] Q := D.mkQ let q0 : Q := m0 let S : Set Q := '' C have hq0S' : q0 S := by simpa [q0, S, ] using hq0S have hq0A' : q0 affineSpan S := by simpa [q0, S, ] using hq0A rcases hCne with c0, hc0C let s0 : Q := c0 have hs0S : s0 S := c0, hc0C, rfl let A : AffineSubspace Q := affineSpan S have hq0A_A : q0 A := by simpa [A] using hq0A' have hs0A_A : s0 A := subset_affineSpan S hs0S let A0 : AffineSubspace (Fin n ) := affineSpan C let V0 : Submodule (Fin n ) := A0.direction let f0 : V0 [] Q := .comp V0.subtype let V : Submodule Q := Submodule.map V0 have hdir : A.direction = V := by -- Use `AffineSubspace.map_span` and `AffineSubspace.map_direction`. have hmap : A0.map .toAffineMap = A := by simpa [A0, A, S] using (AffineSubspace.map_span (k := ) (s := C) (f := .toAffineMap)) -- Now compare directions. simpa [V, V0, hmap] using (AffineSubspace.map_direction (s := A0) (f := .toAffineMap)) have hv0mem : q0 - s0 V := by have : q0 - s0 A.direction := AffineSubspace.vsub_mem_direction hq0A_A hs0A_A simpa [vsub_eq_sub, hdir] using this let v0 : V := q0 - s0, hv0mem -- Translate `C` to an open convex set in `V0`. let O0 : Set V0 := {v : V0 | ((v : Fin n ) + c0) C} have hO0open : IsOpen O0 := by simpa [O0, A0, V0] using (isOpen_translate_in_direction_of_relOpen (E := Fin n ) (C := C) hCrelopen (c0 := c0) hc0C) have hO0conv : Convex O0 := by intro x hx y hy a b ha hb hab have hxC : ((x : Fin n ) + c0) C := hx have hyC : ((y : Fin n ) + c0) C := hy have : a ((x : Fin n ) + c0) + b ((y : Fin n ) + c0) C := hCconv hxC hyC ha hb hab -- Rewrite the convex combination as `(a x + b y) + c0`. have hcalc : a ((x : Fin n ) + c0) + b ((y : Fin n ) + c0) = ((a x + b y : V0) : Fin n ) + c0 := by -- Expand, collect the `c0` terms using `add_smul`, then use `a + b = 1`. calc a ((x : Fin n ) + c0) + b ((y : Fin n ) + c0) = (a (x : Fin n ) + b (y : Fin n )) + (a c0 + b c0) := by simp [smul_add, add_assoc, add_left_comm, add_comm] _ = (a (x : Fin n ) + b (y : Fin n )) + (a + b) c0 := by simp [add_smul] _ = (a (x : Fin n ) + b (y : Fin n )) + c0 := by simp [hab] _ = ((a x + b y : V0) : Fin n ) + c0 := by simp [add_assoc] have : ((a x + b y : V0) : Fin n ) + c0 C := by -- Rewrite the membership along `hcalc`. exact (by simpa using (hcalc this)) simpa [O0] using this -- Push `O0` forward to an open convex set in `V`. let g : V0 [] V := { toFun := fun v => f0 v, by exact (v : Fin n ), v.2, rfl map_add' := by intro x y ext simp [f0] map_smul' := by intro r x ext simp [f0] } let T : Set V := ((fun v : V0 => (f0 v, by exact (v : Fin n ), v.2, rfl : V)) '' O0) have hTopen : IsOpen T := isOpen_image_direction_mkQ_of_isOpen (C := C) (D := D) O0 hO0open have hTconv : Convex T := by -- `T` is the linear image of the convex set `O0`. simpa [T, g] using (hO0conv.linear_image g) have hv0not : v0 T := by intro hv0T rcases hv0T with v, hvO0, hvEq have hvEq' : f0 v = q0 - s0 := by simpa [g, v0] using congrArg Subtype.val hvEq have hcC : ((v : Fin n ) + c0) C := by simpa [O0] using hvO0 have hq0mem : q0 S := by refine (v : Fin n ) + c0, hcC, ?_ calc ((v : Fin n ) + c0) = (v : Fin n ) + c0 := by simp [, map_add] _ = f0 v + s0 := by simp [f0, s0] _ = (q0 - s0) + s0 := by simp [hvEq'] _ = q0 := sub_add_cancel q0 s0 exact hq0S' hq0mem -- Separate the open convex set `T` from the point `v0`. obtain fV, hfV := geometric_hahn_banach_open_point (E := V) hTconv hTopen hv0not -- Extend `fV` from the submodule `V` to the whole quotient space `Q`. obtain gQ, hgQ := LinearMap.exists_extend (p := V) (f := fV.toLinearMap) haveI : IsModuleTopology Q := by infer_instance let f : StrongDual Q := { toLinearMap := gQ cont := IsModuleTopology.continuous_of_linearMap gQ } refine f, ?_ intro c hcC -- Build the translated direction element corresponding to `c - c0`. have hcA0 : c A0 := subset_affineSpan C hcC have hc0A0 : c0 A0 := subset_affineSpan C hc0C have hsub : c - c0 V0 := by simpa [V0, vsub_eq_sub] using (AffineSubspace.vsub_mem_direction hcA0 hc0A0) let v : V0 := c - c0, hsub have hvO0 : v O0 := by -- `v + c0 = c`. simpa [O0, v, sub_add_cancel] using hcC have hvT : g v T := v, hvO0, rfl have hltV : fV (g v) < fV v0 := hfV (g v) hvT -- Transfer the inequality to `f` on `Q`. have hcomp : w : V, f w = fV w := by intro w -- `gQ` agrees with `fV` on `V`. have : gQ (V.subtype w) = fV w := by -- from `hgQ : gQ.comp V.subtype = fV.toLinearMap` simpa using congrArg (fun h : V [] => h w) hgQ simpa [f] using this have hltQ : f ((g v : V) : Q) < f (v0 : Q) := by simpa [hcomp] using hltV -- Rewrite the translated inequality as `f ( c) < f q0`. have : f ( c) < f q0 := by have h' := add_lt_add_left hltQ (f s0) have hsum_left : f ((g v : V) : Q) + f s0 = f (((g v : V) : Q) + s0) := by simp have hsum_right : f (v0 : Q) + f s0 = f ((v0 : Q) + s0) := by simp have h'' : f (((g v : V) : Q) + s0) < f ((v0 : Q) + s0) := by have h'' := h' rw [hsum_left, hsum_right] at h'' exact h'' -- Simplify the translated points. have hgv : ((g v : V) : Q) + s0 = c := by -- `g v` is ` (c - c0)` and `s0 = c0`. simp [g, f0, , s0, v, map_sub, sub_add_cancel] have hv0 : (v0 : Q) + s0 = q0 := by simp [v0, q0, s0, sub_add_cancel] simpa [hgv, hv0] using h'' -- Return the desired strict inequality. simpa [q0, ] using this

Key separation lemma for Theorem 11.2 (to be filled): in the quotient by Unknown identifier `M.direction`M.direction, the convex relatively-open set Unknown identifier `C`C can be strictly separated from the point corresponding to Unknown identifier `M`M.

lemma exists_strictSep_point_image_mkQ_of_disjoint_convex_relativelyOpen (n : Nat) (C : Set (Fin n )) (M : AffineSubspace (Fin n )) (hCne : C.Nonempty) (hCconv : Convex C) (hCrelopen : U : Set (Fin n ), IsOpen U C = U (affineSpan C : Set (Fin n ))) {m0 : Fin n } (hm0 : m0 M) (hCM : Disjoint C (M : Set (Fin n ))) : f : StrongDual ((Fin n ) M.direction), ( c C, f (M.direction.mkQ c) < f (M.direction.mkQ m0)) ( c C, f (M.direction.mkQ m0) < f (M.direction.mkQ c)) := by classical let D : Submodule (Fin n ) := M.direction let Q := (Fin n ) D let : (Fin n ) [] Q := D.mkQ let S : Set Q := '' C let q0 : Q := m0 have hq0S : q0 S := by simpa [D, , S, q0] using (quotient_point_not_mem_image_of_disjoint (C := C) M hm0 hCM) have hSnonempty : S.Nonempty := hCne.image have hSconv : Convex S := hCconv.linear_image let A : AffineSubspace Q := affineSpan S by_cases hq0A : q0 A /- Hard case (`q0 affineSpan ( '' C)`): the set `S := '' C` is convex and *relatively open* in its affine span `A := affineSpan S`, and `q0 S`. One should translate to the direction submodule `A.direction`, show the translated set is open there, apply `geometric_hahn_banach_open_point` to separate `0`, and extend the resulting functional from `A.direction` to `Q`. -/ obtain f, hf := exists_strictSep_point_of_mem_affineSpan_openIn_convex n C D hCne hCconv hCrelopen hq0S (by simpa [A, S, , q0] using hq0A) exact f, Or.inl hf -- If `q0` is outside `affineSpan S`, a functional constant on `affineSpan S` suffices. have hq0A' : q0 affineSpan S := by simpa [A] using hq0A obtain f, hf := exists_strictSep_point_of_not_mem_affineSpan (E := Q) (S := S) hSnonempty hq0A' refine f, Or.inl ?_ intro c hcC exact hf ( c) c, hcC, rfl

A continuous linear functional on ^ sorry : Type^Unknown identifier `n`n is determined by its values on the coordinate vectors.

lemma strongDual_apply_eq_sum_mul_single {n : Nat} (g : StrongDual (Fin n )) (x : Fin n ) : g x = i : Fin n, x i * g (Pi.single (M := fun _ : Fin n => ) i (1 : )) := by classical have hx : ( i : Fin n, Pi.single (M := fun _ : Fin n => ) i (x i)) = x := by simpa using (LinearMap.sum_single_apply (v := x) : ( i : Fin n, Pi.single (M := fun _ : Fin n => ) i (x i)) = x) rw [ hx] simp only [map_sum] refine Finset.sum_congr rfl ?_ intro i _hi have hsingle : Pi.single (M := fun _ : Fin n => ) i (x i) = (x i) Pi.single (M := fun _ : Fin n => ) i (1 : ) := by ext j by_cases h : j = i subst h simp simp [Pi.single, h] simp [hsingle, smul_eq_mul]

Convert a continuous linear functional on ^ sorry : Type^Unknown identifier `n`n into a dotProduct against a vector.

lemma strongDual_apply_eq_dotProduct {n : Nat} (g : StrongDual (Fin n )) : x : Fin n , g x = x (fun i => g (Pi.single (M := fun _ : Fin n => ) i (1 : ))) := by classical intro x -- both sides are the same coordinate sum simpa [dotProduct] using (strongDual_apply_eq_sum_mul_single g x)

Theorem 11.2: Let Unknown identifier `C`C be a non-empty relatively open convex set in Unknown identifier `R`sorry ^ sorry : ?m.5R^Unknown identifier `n`n, and let Unknown identifier `M`M be a non-empty affine set in Unknown identifier `R`sorry ^ sorry : ?m.5R^Unknown identifier `n`n not meeting Unknown identifier `C`C. Then there exists a hyperplane Unknown identifier `H`H containing Unknown identifier `M`M, such that one of the open half-spaces associated with Unknown identifier `H`H contains Unknown identifier `C`C.

theorem exists_hyperplane_contains_affine_of_convex_relativelyOpen (n : Nat) (C : Set (Fin n Real)) (M : AffineSubspace Real (Fin n Real)) (hCne : C.Nonempty) (hCconv : Convex Real C) (hCrelopen : U : Set (Fin n Real), IsOpen U C = U (affineSpan Real C : Set (Fin n Real))) (hMne : (M : Set (Fin n Real)).Nonempty) (hCM : Disjoint C (M : Set (Fin n Real))) : H : Set (Fin n Real), (M : Set (Fin n Real)) H (b : Fin n Real) ( : Real), b 0 H = {x : Fin n Real | x b = } (C {x : Fin n Real | x b < } C {x : Fin n Real | < x b}) := by classical rcases hMne with m0, hm0 -- Work in the quotient by the direction of `M`, where `M` becomes a single point. let D : Submodule (Fin n ) := M.direction let Q := (Fin n ) D let : (Fin n ) [] Q := D.mkQ have hcont : Continuous := .continuous_of_finiteDimensional let L : (Fin n ) L[] Q := { toLinearMap := , cont := hcont } obtain f, hfsep := exists_strictSep_point_image_mkQ_of_disjoint_convex_relativelyOpen n C M hCne hCconv hCrelopen hm0 hCM let g : StrongDual (Fin n ) := f.comp L have hg_dot : x : Fin n , g x = x (fun i => g (Pi.single (M := fun _ : Fin n => ) i (1 : ))) := strongDual_apply_eq_dotProduct g let b : Fin n := fun i => g (Pi.single (M := fun _ : Fin n => ) i (1 : )) let : := g m0 have hg_ne0 : g 0 := by intro hg0 rcases hCne with c0, hc0 cases hfsep with | inl hlt => have : g c0 < g m0 := by simpa [g, L, , Submodule.mkQ_apply] using hlt c0 hc0 simp [hg0] at this | inr hgt => have : g m0 < g c0 := by simpa [g, L, , Submodule.mkQ_apply] using hgt c0 hc0 simp [hg0] at this have hb_ne0 : b 0 := by intro hb0 apply hg_ne0 ext x have : g x = x b := by simpa [b] using (hg_dot x) simp [this, hb0] refine {x : Fin n | x b = }, ?_, b, , hb_ne0, rfl, ?_ intro m hmM have hsub : m - m0 D := by simpa [D, vsub_eq_sub] using (AffineSubspace.vsub_mem_direction hmM hm0) have hEq' : (Submodule.Quotient.mk m : (Fin n ) D) = Submodule.Quotient.mk m0 := (Submodule.Quotient.eq (p := D)).2 hsub have hEq : m = m0 := by simpa [, Submodule.mkQ_apply] using hEq' have hEqL : L m = L m0 := by simpa [L] using hEq have : g m = g m0 := by -- `g` is `f ` simpa [g] using congrArg f hEqL -- rewrite `g` as dotProduct against `b` have hg_m : g m = m b := by simpa [b] using (hg_dot m) have hg_m0 : g m0 = m0 b := by simpa [b] using (hg_dot m0) -- finish simpa [, hg_m, hg_m0, this] cases hfsep with | inl hlt => left intro c hcC have : g c < := by -- transport the strict inequality from the quotient simpa [g, L, , , Submodule.mkQ_apply] using hlt c hcC have hg_c : g c = c b := by simpa [b] using (hg_dot c) simpa [hg_c, ] using this | inr hgt => right intro c hcC have : < g c := by simpa [g, L, , , Submodule.mkQ_apply] using hgt c hcC have hg_c : g c = c b := by simpa [b] using (hg_dot c) simpa [hg_c, ] using this

Minkowski subtraction is Minkowski addition with pointwise negation.

lemma set_sub_eq_add_neg {E : Type*} [AddGroup E] (A B : Set E) : A - B = A + (-B) := by ext x constructor rintro a, ha, b, hb, rfl refine a, ha, -b, ?_, ?_ simpa using hb simp [sub_eq_add_neg] rintro a, ha, c, hc, rfl have hc' : -c B := by simpa using hc refine a, ha, -c, hc', ?_ simp [sub_eq_add_neg]

Pointwise negation equals scalar multiplication by -1 : -1.

lemma neg_set_eq_smul {E : Type*} [AddCommGroup E] [Module Real E] (C : Set E) : -C = ((-1 : Real) C) := by ext x constructor intro hx have hx' : -x C := by simpa using hx refine -x, hx', ?_ simp rintro y, hy, rfl simpa using hy

A continuous linear equivalence maps intrinsic interiors.

lemma ContinuousLinearEquiv.image_intrinsicInterior { E F : Type*} [NontriviallyNormedField ] [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace E] [NormedAddCommGroup F] [NormedSpace F] (e : E L[] F) (s : Set E) : intrinsicInterior (e '' s) = e '' intrinsicInterior s := by classical -- Work in the affine spans, where `intrinsicInterior` is ordinary `interior`. let A : AffineSubspace E := affineSpan s let B : AffineSubspace F := affineSpan (e '' s) have hAB : x : E, x A e x B := by intro x -- Use `B = A.map e` and the injectivity of `e`. have hmap : A.map e.toAffineEquiv.toAffineMap = B := by simpa [A, B] using (AffineSubspace.map_span (k := ) (f := e.toAffineEquiv.toAffineMap) s) -- `x A e x A.map e` simpa [hmap] using (AffineSubspace.mem_map_iff_mem_of_injective (f := e.toAffineEquiv.toAffineMap) (x := x) (s := A) (hf := e.injective)).symm let f : A B := (e.toHomeomorph.subtype (p := fun x : E => x A) (q := fun y : F => y B) hAB) have hcoe : (fun y : B => (y : F)) = fun y => e ((f.symm y : A) : E) := by ext y -- `f.symm` is induced by `e.symm` on the underlying points. simp [f, Homeomorph.subtype] have hpre : (() : B F) ' (e '' s) = f.symm ' ((() : A E) ' s) := by ext y constructor intro hy rcases hy with x, hx, hxy -- `e (f.symm y) = y`, so `f.symm y` is `e.symm y`. have : (f.symm y : A) = x, by have hxA : x A := subset_affineSpan (k := ) (s := s) hx simpa [A] using hxA := by ext -- underlying point have : e x = (y : F) := by simp [hxy] -- apply `e.symm` on both sides simpa using (congrArg e.symm this).symm have hxpre : (f.symm y : E) s := by -- the underlying point of `f.symm y` is `x` simpa [this] using hx simpa [hcoe] using hxpre intro hy -- `f.symm y s` implies `y = e (f.symm y) e '' s`. have : e ((f.symm y : A) : E) e '' s := (f.symm y : E), by simpa using hy, rfl simpa [hcoe] using this -- Now translate the definition of `intrinsicInterior` through `f`. calc intrinsicInterior (e '' s) = (() : B F) '' interior ((() : B F) ' (e '' s)) := by simp [intrinsicInterior, B] _ = (fun y : B => e ((f.symm y : A) : E)) '' interior ((() : B F) ' (e '' s)) := by simp [hcoe] _ = e '' ((() : A E) '' (f.symm '' interior ((() : B F) ' (e '' s)))) := by simp [Set.image_image] _ = e '' ((() : A E) '' interior ((() : A E) ' s)) := by -- Use that `f.symm` is a homeomorphism, and rewrite the pulled-back set via `hpre`. have : f.symm '' interior ((() : B F) ' (e '' s)) = interior ((() : A E) ' s) := by -- `f.symm` maps `interior` to `interior` of the image. have himage : f.symm '' interior ((() : B F) ' (e '' s)) = interior (f.symm '' ((() : B F) ' (e '' s))) := by simpa using (f.symm.image_interior ((() : B F) ' (e '' s))) -- and `f.symm '' preimage = preimage` using `hpre`. have himage2 : f.symm '' ((() : B F) ' (e '' s)) = ((() : A E) ' s) := by -- since `f` is an equivalence, `f.symm '' t = f ' t` -- and `hpre` is exactly that preimage. ext x constructor rintro y, hy, rfl simpa [hpre] using hy intro hx refine f x, ?_, by simp simpa [hpre] using hx simpa [himage2] using himage simp [this] _ = e '' intrinsicInterior s := by simp [intrinsicInterior, A]
end Section11end Chap03
